wikipedia_page.main: Lt. Col Walter Martin Fitzherbert Turner (4 April 1881 – 1 February 1948) was an English cricketer. He played for Essex between 1899 and 1911, and the Europeans. A ‘strong driver and cutter’ his cricketing career covered 27 seasons when on leave from military service.

response: His younger brother Walter also played cricket for Essex,http://www.cricketarchive.co.uk/Archive/Players/5/5336/5336.html Walter Turner whilst another brother John played first-class cricket in India,John Turner at CricketArchive as did his nephew Antony.Antony Turner at CricketArchive
